alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:44AM EDT until May 04 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Tioga and Bradford Counties. Chenango River At Sherburne affecting Chenango County. Chenango River At Greene affecting Chenango County. Chenango River At Chenango Forks affecting Broome County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River At Conklin. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Alta, River and Lawrence Roads closed in the Town of Conklin due to minor flooding. No homes are flooded at this river stage. Valley park in Kirkwood takes on water. At 14.0 feet, Water begins to affect properties closest to the river from Corbettsville to Five Mile Point. Some water begins to back up into Schnurbusch Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
